title: How to compensate Ornn so he doesn't end up gutted with his nerf (A level 7 Ornn)
body:
As the title says...

{{champion:516}} is currently sitting at a 48% win rate:
http://na.op.gg/champion/ornn/statistics/top
http://champion.gg/champion/Ornn/Top?league=

As a level 7 {{champion:516}}, he is going to be needing some sort of compensation if the current nerf goes through.

{{champion:516}} has little to no sustain while in lane and could use some sort of sustain.

W: Bellows Breath

Shield strength increased from 12% to 16% all ranks of {{champion:516}}'s maximum health

**New Effect** Ornn now heals 2/4/6/8/10% of his missing health against enemy champions afflicted with brittle

replies.body: Sad to see the nerf go through. The small amount of skill expression in his kit has been removed.

Ornn doesn't have sustain because of his passive.

If he had sustain, wouldn't it be next to impossible to force him out of lane since he doesn't need to back to build stats?
Ornn isn't losing any stats at all. Why would he need sustain when he has been fine without it this whole time. His w still gets a shield and he still will win 1v1s against melee.

Do you honestly think giving ornn (A CHAMPION THAT DOESN'T NEED TO BACK FOR ITEMS) sustain is a good idea?

This isn't a troll thread right?

>
> Do you honestly think giving ornn (A CHAMPION THAT DOESN'T NEED TO BACK FOR ITEMS) sustain is a good idea?
> 
> This isn't a troll thread right?

It is mainly for ranged poke and to help him in 1v1s.
If Ornn had innate sustain he would almost never be forced out of lane thanks to his passive...
